about:
As the Founder and Chief Executive Officer of CoStar Group, Andrew C. Florance has dedicated nearly four decades to digitizing the real estate industry through innovation and technology, fundamentally changing the way commercial real estate professionals access, use and share information. Since founding CoStar Group in his dorm room in 1986, he led the company’s growth from a groundbreaking startup to a market-leading enterprise that is publicly traded on NASDAQ (CSGP) and included in the S&P 500 and NASDAQ 100.  
 
CoStar Group has grown to serve over 1 million clients globally, with its websites garnering well over 1 billion visitors in the past year alone. CoStar Group's industry-leading suite of brands, including CoStar, Apartments.com, Homes.com, LoopNet, STR, Ten-X, BizBuySell, and Land.com, are home to the most up-to-date real estate information, analytics and online marketplaces.  
  
Recognized for its rapid growth and innovation, CoStar Group has earned placements on Forbes’ 100 Most Innovative Growth Companies and Fast Tech 25, as well as Fortune’s 100 Fastest Growing Companies. Andrew Florance has been honored with numerous accolades, such as Globee Visionary Leader of the Year, Globee CEO of the Year, and inclusion in Commercial Observer’s 30 Most Powerful People in Commercial Real Estate Proptech, Inman’s Power Player list, Commercial Observer’s Power 100, and the SP 200 Real Estate’s Most Powerful and Influential List.  
 
Beyond his professional achievements, Andy Florance is passionate about contributing to the community. He serves on the Cathedral Chapter of the Washington National Cathedral, the Board of Visitors for Virginia Commonwealth University, and Management Leadership for Tomorrow, a nonprofit dedicated to developing diverse leaders.

people_also_viewed.name: Tom Monahan

position: Founder and CEO of CoStar Group | Transforming Real Estate with Innovative Technology | Leading Global Real Estate Data and Analytics

publications.description: “A Comprehensive Approach to Commercial Real Estate Prices,” won an ARES manuscript prize in 2010, used a repeat-sale regression analysis to track price movements within CoStar’s extensive database. This information led to the now renowned CoStar Commercial Repeat Sale Indices (CCRSI), believed to be the most comprehensive and thorough commercial real estate repeat-sale price tool available in the market today. In 2012, the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System included the CCRSI in their analysis used to produce the “Flow of Funds Accounts of the United States,” an indicator of economy-wide performance.
publications.subtitle: Journal of Real Estate Portfolio Management
publications.title: "A Comprehensive Approach to Commercial Real Estate Prices"

publications.description: Co-authored two additional studies published in JREPM. "Slicing, Dicing, and Scoping the Size of the U.S. Commercial Real Estate Market," coauthored with N. Miller, R. Peng and J. Spivey, won JREPM’s “Best Article” award from the American Real Estate Society in 2010. This JREPM article (16:1) was the first analysis to use direct measurement of commercial property to document the full size and scope of the US commercial real estate market as an $11 trillion asset class.
publications.subtitle: Journal of Real Estate Portfolio Management
publications.title: "Slicing, Dicing and Scoping the Size of the U.S. Commercial Real Estate Market"

publications.description: Conceived and co-authored the first comprehensive analysis of leasing and sales activity in energy-efficient office buildings in the United States. The study, published in the Journal of Real Estate Portfolio Management (“Does Green Pay Off”; N. Miller, J. Spivey and A. Florence; 14:1), was selected by the American Real Estate Society as the “Best Article” published in JREPM for 2008. The groundbreaking study was also cited as a critical factor in CoStar Group’s selection as the only commercial real estate-related company to win an ENERGY STAR Award for Excellence from the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency in 2009. CoStar currently partners with the Department of Energy to further promote energy efficiency in buildings by publishing energy scores for as many commercial buildings as possible.
publications.subtitle: Journal of Real Estate Portfolio Management
publications.title: "Does Green Pay Off?"

recommendations: LinkedIn User “Getting the opportunity to work with Andrew everyday is wonderful. His dedication to the team through collaboration, attention to detail in everything he does, enthusiasm and strong work ethic stand out above the rest. Andrew’s presentation skills are exceptional. He has a natural ability to command a room and get people engaged. His style incorporates innovative ideas and a strong knowledge to the subject. I have had the pleasure of working on multiple Request For Proposals (RFP) with Andrew and he is always willing to assist and take ownership of specific areas to ensure success. Andrew is a huge asset to the group! ”
